channel.title: Git on Dinis Peixoto
channel.description: Recent content in Git on Dinis Peixoto

item.title: Git Add Patch
item.description: It’s always fun when you find something entirely new, especially when it’s a quirk/feature on a tool that you use daily. This time around, I’ll be writing about git, in particular an option that you can use when stagging content for your next commit. Most of the times, I either use git add <file> or if I’m sure that every unstaged change should be stagged git add .. Today I found out the git add --patch, or git add -p for short.
